question: Im 5'8". I wanna 125-130 pounds. Would that be healthy?
question_content:
I'm currently 150. :(
ewwwww.




****Could you please give me workout tips or something. :)
Thanks in advance :)

10 points to the most descriptive &detailed answer. :)

answers.answer_content:
There are many diff things that a person must know about you before you can put together a real workout program or even tell you if you should try to get down to your target weight. 
a) how old are you?
b) have you had children?
c) what is your basic body structure?
Those are all very important things to know. That being said if you do a good cardio workout like zumba or aerobics at a basic gym you will become ealthier and shed the extra pounds while under the watchful eye of a trainer.

Well, I am also 5'8 too. 
I weigh a total of 141, and the LEAST I will go down to is 135. 
I try to eat healthy and everything. I am comfortable with the weight I am now, but 135 is my dream weight. I am only six pounds away, but really, don't go past that. We are tall girls. :)

Go walking alot, include veggies in every meal, and don't eat too many fatty foods even though it can be hard at times.
 
If you're five foot you add 100 pounds, and every inch add 5 more.. So 140 pounds is an ideal weight for the both of us. 

Good luck!

You should start a workout routine and be serious about it. Change the way you eat, if your going to eat fast food your best is choice is subway and don't add any sauces. losing 25 pounds will NOT NOT NOT be easy but it can be done, and the best thing to do at the gym is watch what others do and try them and make sure to do them properly and to ask to be shown the right way if you don't feel that you are doing it the way it should be done
Thats not really healthy for your height.I am 5 foot 3 and i weigh 118 pounds so that would make you underweight
